title: Scientists Find Way to Make Tap Water Good

content.en: Very small pieces of plastic are in our tap water. These pieces are called microplastics. They are so small we can't see them. And they are in our bodies too. This is NOT good for us!
content.tw: 我們喝的水裡，有一些小到看不見的塑膠微粒，跑到身體裡對我們很不好喔！

content.en: What can we do about microplastics in our tap water? Some scientists have a good idea. Ask your parents to help with this!
content.tw: 該怎麼處理呢? 科學家們有個好點子，你可以請你爸媽來幫忙!

content.en: The scientists say to boil the water first. Make water very hot. Is it making big bubbles? It's boiling! Boil it for five minutes.
content.tw: 首先要把水煮沸。熱水開始冒泡泡之後，繼續煮五分鐘。

content.en: How does this help us take microplastics from the water? Well, water has minerals in it. After the water dries, sometimes we see something white. We see minerals. Microplastics stick to them.
content.tw: 這樣有什麼幫助呢？水煮完以後，我們會看到一些白色的東西，那是礦物質，而塑膠微粒會黏在上面。

content.en: Is this water ready to drink? Nope. The minerals and microplastics are still in it. But now it's easy to take them out.
content.tw: 這樣做還不夠，不過這些礦物質跟塑膠微粒很容易可以過濾出來。

content.en: How? Pour the water into a coffee filter. Be careful! And … 25% to 90% of microplastics are gone!
content.tw: 只要用咖啡濾紙小心地過濾自來水，就可以去除百分之 25 到 90 的塑膠微粒!

content.en: Let's boil and filter tap water before we drink it. This is good for us!
content.tw: 在喝自來水之前，讓我們將它煮沸並過濾。這對我們有益！

vocabulary.preface: 自來水裡面的細微塑膠顆粒，要處理掉並不難。

content.text:
1. tap water 自來水。
Hey, don't drink tap water. 嘿，不要喝自來水。
I know. I'm just too thirsty. 我知道，我只是太口渴了。

2. boil 煮。
Let me boil some water. 我來煮一點開水。
Then I can make oolong tea for you.然後來泡烏龍茶給你喝。
Thank you, tea would be lovely. 謝謝，喝茶很好。

3. minute 分鐘。
Just give me 10 minutes.只要給我十分鐘。
Here you are. 茶來了。
Ah, this is so nice! 真舒服!

4. drink 喝。
You know, I usually drink coffee. 我通常喝咖啡。
But this tea is better than any coffee.不過這個茶比什麼咖啡都好。
Great! I'm happy to hear that. 真棒，我很高興聽你這麼說。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天你學到哪些單字?
tap water自來水 boil煮 minute分鐘 drink喝

content.en: Have you been to Taroko Gorge? It's in Hualien. It's very beautiful.
content.tw: 你去過花蓮的太魯閣峽谷嗎?那裏很漂亮。

content.en: Taroko Gorge's name comes from the Taroko people. The Taroko people are one of the Indigenous Taiwanese peoples. Most live in Hualien.
content.tw: 太魯閣峽谷的名字來自一個原住民太魯閣族。

content.en: Some say the Taroko people first came to Taiwan's southwest coast. Tainan is there now. But Hualien is on the east coast of Taiwan. How did they come so far? And why?
content.tw: 傳說太魯閣族最早來到台灣的西南部，也就是現在的台南，但是現在他們住在台灣的東部花蓮，他們怎麼跑了這麼遠呢?

content.en: Not much was known about the Taroko people's past. Different people knew different parts of the Taroko people's past. But no one knew all of it.
content.tw: 沒有人了解太魯閣族全部的歷史，不同的人知道不同的部分。

content.en: A new book has changed this! It took more than ten years to write. The writer went to many Taroko groups. He talked with more than one hundred and eighty people!
content.tw: 但現在有一本關於他們歷史的書! 作者花了10 年以上，訪問了 180 多個太魯閣族人才寫完。

content.en: This book is important. It tells how and why the Taroko people went from the southwest to the east of Taiwan.
content.tw: 這本書很重要，它告訴我們太魯閣族搬到花蓮的原因還有過程。

content.en: The Taroko people have a great past. Thanks to this book, they can share their story with the world!
content.tw: 太魯閣族人有著輝煌的歷史。多虧了這本書，他們得以與世界分享他們的故事！

vocabulary.preface: 現在有一本新書，告訴讀者原住民太魯閣族人的歷史。

content.text:
1. write 寫作.
If I write a book about birds, would you buy
it?假如我寫一本有關鳥類的書，你會買嗎?
No.不會.
Why not? 為什麼不?
I'm not interested in birds.我對鳥兒沒有興趣.

2. past 過去.
What are you interested in? 你對什麼有興趣?
Your past.你的過去.
My past? 我的過去?
Yeah, what you did and how you became who you are.

3. why 為什麼.
Why do you want to read a book about me? 為何你想讀關於我的書?
I like to hear people's stories. 我喜歡聽別人的故事。

4. different 不同的.
I've never done anything great.我沒有做過什麼了不起的事.
Well, you're different from anyone I know. 你跟我認識的人都不一樣.
So I'd like to find out more.所以我想多知道一點。

vocabulary.postscript:
你今天學的單字有哪幾個?
write寫作 past過去 why為什麼 different不同的

2. Where in Taiwan is Tainan?
3. Where do most Taroko people live?

content.en: Narrator: There's a brave dog in Peru. He is a hero at a gas station!
content.tw: 祕魯的一個加油站裡，有一隻勇敢的狗狗英雄!

content.en: The dog was a stray dog. He didn't have a home. He was thin, and he was hungry all the time.
content.tw: 牠本來是一隻無家可歸的流浪狗，而且一直挨餓。

content.en: Some kind workers at a gas station started giving him food. So the dog loves to go there.
content.tw: 有一些加油站員工會餵給牠食物，所以牠很愛跑去加油站。

content.en: One day, something very scary happened! Two bad people tried to take things from the gas station. Robber 1: Put the money in the bag! Narrator: They were robbers! But the dog came to the rescue!
content.tw: 有一天，兩個可怕的搶匪到加油站搶劫! 這時候，狗狗英雄出現了!

content.en: The robbers tried to scare the dog … Robber 2: Shoo! Go away! Narrator: … But he was brave! He barked loudly. He chased the robbers away! The workers were very thankful for the dog!
content.tw: 搶匪試著把牠嚇走，但牠很勇敢，邊叫邊把搶匪趕跑! 員工們都很感謝牠。

content.en: Now the dog is a guard at the gas station! He wears a red shirt with yellow sleeves. The workers wear a red shirt with yellow sleeves too! He wears an ID card with his picture.
content.tw: 現在這隻狗是加油站的警衛! 牠和其他員工一樣穿著制服，還有貼著牠的照片的員工證。

content.en: He has a nice doghouse. And now he gets breakfast, lunch, and dinner every day!
content.tw: 牠現在有家可以住，三餐也都吃得飽飽的!

content.en: This brave dog is an important worker at the gas station. He keeps everyone there safe!
content.tw: 這隻勇敢的狗是加油站的重要員工。牠保護那裡的每個人安全！

vocabulary.preface: 祕魯一隻流浪犬，救了加油站。

content.text:
1. breakfast 早餐。
Guess who showed up for breakfast today? 猜猜看今天誰來吃早餐？
Please tell me it wasn't another stray dog! 請告訴我不是另外一隻流浪狗。

2. stray dog 流浪犬。
It was! But this stray dog is different.牠是耶，不過這隻流浪狗不一樣。
All of them are the same for me.牠們對我來說都一樣。

3. bark 叫喊。
No, no, this one was very friendly. 不，這隻狗很友善。
It barked loudly as if saying "Hello"! 牠大聲叫，好像在說哈囉。
I find barking dogs scary. 我覺得一直叫的狗很恐怖。

4. chase away 趕走。
I'm thinking of keeping it. 我想要養牠。
It can chase away thieves. 牠會趕走小偷。
I'll move away before it does that. 我會在牠那樣做之前搬家。

vocabulary.postscript:
Are you afraid of dogs? 請來讀單字。
breakfast早餐 stray dog流浪犬 bark叫喊 chase away趕走

quiz.question: 1. Where does the dog live?
2. What kind of dog was the dog before?
3. What did the dog wear after he became a hero?

content.en: On a mountain in Taiwan, a scientist climbs a giant tree. It is 67 meters tall. That's as tall as a 20-story building!
content.tw: 在台灣的山上，科學家正在攀爬一棵巨大的樹。這棵樹有 67 公尺高，就像 20 層樓那麼高!

content.en: Giant trees don't grow in many places. But many giant trees grew in Taiwan. Mountain forests were full of giant trees. But for a long time, people cut them down for wood. Now they cannot cut them.
content.tw: 台灣的深山裡有很多世界稀有的巨大樹木，很久以前，人們會把樹木砍掉作木材，現在不能這麼做。

content.en: There are about one thousand giant trees now. But some of these trees are dying!
content.tw: 台灣大概有 1000 棵巨大樹木，但有一些已經快死掉了!

content.en: Having fewer trees is bad news for everyone. Trees help keep the air clean. They help cool the Earth!
content.tw: 樹變少對大家是不好的，樹幫助我們保持空氣乾淨，也讓地球更涼爽!

content.en: Now scientists are studying the trees. They climb up the trees. They see if the trees are growing bigger. But they don't climb all the giant trees! They also use radar and drones.
content.tw: 科學家會爬到樹上檢查樹木的狀況，但他們並不是爬上所有的大樹！他們還會使用雷達跟無人機來協助。

content.en: Scientists think climate change is making some of these trees die. Trees are strong. But climate change is happening too fast for them.
content.tw: 科學家認為氣候快速的變遷，讓很多樹木死亡。

content.en: These giant trees need our help. How can we help? We need to slow down climate change. Then these trees can keep growing for many more years!
content.tw: 這些巨樹需要我們的幫助。我們能如何幫助？我們需要減緩氣候變遷。這樣這些樹就能繼續生長許多年！

vocabulary.preface: 台灣有很多巨大的老樹，要靠你我來保護。

content.text:
1. tall 高的。
Look at that tree! 你看那棵樹。
It's so tall, you'd feel it could touch the sky!
它好高，感覺碰到了天空。Imagine the view up there. 想像一下上面的景觀。

2. climb up 往上爬。
Yeah, you would be able to see the ocean. 是啊，應該可以看到海。
I'd like to climb up there.我想爬上去。
It'll take forever. 會需要很長的時間。

3. cut down 砍掉。
Too bad so many trees got cut down.真可惜好多樹被砍了。
I think the government is growing new ones.我想政府正在種新的。

4. forest 森林。
Good luck with that! 祝它好運。
It takes at least 50 years to grow a forest of these trees.
培養這樣的森林至少要五十年呢。

vocabulary.postscript:
你喜歡爬樹嗎? 跟我一起讀單字。
tall高的 climb up 往上爬 cut down 砍掉 forest 森林

quiz.question: 1. How tall is the tree the scientist is climbing?
2. What do scientists use to study the trees?
3. Why are some of Taiwan's giant trees dying?

title: Jumping Over Water Is a Sport?

content.en: In the Olympics, pole vaulters run with a long pole. They hold the pole and jump high! They let go of the pole! They go over a high bar! They come down on a MAT so they don't get hurt. The pole vaulter with the highest jump wins!
content.tw: 奧運有撐竿跳項目，運動員握著長長的竿子快跑，然後撐在地上讓自己跳起來，越過欄杆，落在軟墊上，跳最高的就能獲勝!

content.en: In the Netherlands, there's a different way to pole vault. Vaulters jump over a wide canal. A canal is a manmade waterway!
content.tw: 在荷蘭，有種不一樣的撐竿跳！參加比賽的人要跳過寬寬的運河。

content.en: Canal vaulters run very fast to a pole. They grab the pole and jump on it! They climb up the pole as fast as they can! The pole goes a little to the other side of the canal.
content.tw: 這些運河撐竿跳運動員要衝向竿子，快速地爬上去，竿子會慢慢向運河的另一側傾斜。

content.en: The vaulters let go of the pole! They come down on sand so they don't get hurt. The canal vaulter with the longest jump wins.
content.tw: 這時運動員要放開竿子，落在對岸的沙子上好避免受傷，跳最遠的就獲勝!

content.en: A long time ago, farmers there jumped canals all the time. Many farms have canals. Farmers used poles to jump canals. It wasn't for fun. They needed to go to the next field!
content.tw: 荷蘭是低地國家，有很多運河。以前荷蘭的農夫常常需要撐竿跳過河，不是為了好玩，而是為了到農田裡工作。

content.en: Now, every year, many people watch the Netherlands' canal jumping contest! Jump far, vaulters!
content.tw: 現在，每年都有許多人觀看荷蘭的運河跳遠比賽！跳遠選手們，加油！

vocabulary.preface: 荷蘭的撐竿跳不是看誰跳得高，而是比誰跳得遠。

content.text:
as fast as 一樣快。
That runner, the first one from the left, 那個左邊的第一個選手，
says he can run as fast as a giraffe.說他可以跑得跟長頸鹿一樣快。
That's a fun way of putting it. 這個說法很好玩。

contest 比賽。
Here we go! 開始了。
Wow, he really runs fast! 哇，他真的跑很快!
And he won the contest! 他贏了比賽!

jump 跳。
Let’s watch this event too, the high jump.我們也來看看跳高項目.
What’s so special about it? 那有什麼特別的?

highest 最高的。
I want to see if any jumper breaks the highest record. 我想看看有沒有選手破最高紀錄。
How high is the record? 紀錄有多高?
2.45 meters.兩公尺四五。

vocabulary.postscript: 今天的單字你記住了嗎? as fast as一樣快? ? contest比賽? ? jump跳? ? highest最高的

quiz.question: What is an Olympic sport?
Where do people take part in canal vaulting?
Why did farmers pole vault over canals?
options: b. To go to the next field

title: Taiwan Sends Two Satellites into Space

content.en: Did you know Taiwan has a space agency? It's called TASA. It does cool things!
content.tw: 你知道台灣有太空總署 TASA 嗎? 他們會做些很酷的事情。

content.en: TASA sent two satellites into space. Satellites go around the Earth. They get information or help with communication.
content.tw: TASA 發射了兩枚人造衛星到太空，它們環繞地球，收集各項資料或是協助通訊。

content.en: The Taiwanese satellites are very small. They're thirty centimeters long, ten centimeters tall, and ten centimeters wide!
content.tw: 這些人造衛星非常小，只有 30 公分長、10 公分高，10 公分寬!

content.en: TASA paid a company to take the satellites into space. One day, the company's rocket took off. Two and a half hours later, the satellites were going around and around the Earth!
content.tw: TASA 請了一個公司用火箭發射衛星，火箭起飛後短短的 2 個半小時，衛星就開始繞著地球轉!

content.en: Taiwanese companies made these satellites. They want to enter the space business. If their satellites work well, maybe they can!
content.tw: 這些衛星是台灣公司製造，他們想進入太空產業。如果衛星運作良好，他們就有機會！

content.en: One satellite looks at the ocean's color. The colors show where fish eat. Finding where fish eat helps Taiwan's fishermen.
content.tw: 其中一個衛星觀察海洋的顏色，找出魚群都在哪裡覓食。這個資訊對台灣漁民很重要。

content.en: The other satellite sees if satellites in space are communicating with machines on Earth. TASA helps Taiwanese companies enter the space business! That's great for Taiwan!
content.tw: 另一個衛星則查看太空中的衛星是否與地球上的機器正常通訊。TASA 幫助台灣公司進入太空產業！這對台灣來說太棒了！

vocabulary.preface: 台灣自製的小衛星，可以提供各種資訊。

content.text:
1. satellite 衛星。
That star is moving across the sky! 那顆星星在天上飛!
That's not a star, Paz. 那不是星星。
It's a satellite. 是一顆人造衛星。

2. go around 環繞。
How do you know that? 你怎麼知道?
Stars don't move. 星星不會移動。
But this satellite does. 但是這個會。
It goes around the Earth. 它環繞地球運行。

3. make 製造。
So it's made by people? 所以它是人造的?
Yeah, it's manmade and sent to space by a rocket.
對，人造的，然後用火箭送進太空。
That's very cool! 那好酷喔!
I think so too. 我也覺得。

4. do 做。
What does it do? 它做什麼呢?
For one thing, it can see typhoons and tell us when they will come.
比如說它可以看到颱風，然後告訴我們颱風什麼時候來。

vocabulary.postscript: 來一起讀單字。 satellite衛星 go around環繞 make製造 do做

quiz.question: 1. What is Taiwan's space agency called?
2. What sent the Taiwanese satellites into space?
options: b. A Taiwan space agency rocket

quiz.question: 3. What does one of the satellites do?
options: a. Catch fish in the ocean
b. Look at the ocean's color

content.en: What food is this? It can be sweet… It can be bitter… It can be sweet AND bitter! You can eat it... You can drink it... You can wear it too!
content.tw: 猜猜這是什麼食物... 它可以是甜的，是苦的，它也可以又甜又苦，除了吃跟喝以外，你還可以穿在身上!

content.en: This food tastes great with ice cream... or toast… or bacon! It's one of the world's favorite foods. People have enjoyed it for thousands of years. Can you guess what it is?
content.tw: 千百年來人們都喜歡它，不管跟冰淇淋、吐司，或甚至跟培根一起吃，都很美味!

content.en: It's... chocolate! There are many fun things to learn about chocolate!
content.tw: 沒錯! 就是好吃又好玩的巧克力!

content.en: Did you know there's a chocolate museum in Taoyuan? It's Asia's first chocolate museum! You can learn about chocolate. And you can learn about Taiwan's chocolate, from its cocoa trees to its chocolate bars and snacks!
content.tw: 亞洲第一間巧克力博物館就在桃園! 你可以在那裏學到從可可樹到製作巧克力點心的知識。

content.en: You can see the world's tallest chocolate bar! You can see, smell, touch, taste... and hear chocolate! Is that the sound of chocolate in your mouth?
content.tw: 也可以在那裏看到世界最高的巧克力棒，除了看到、聞到、摸到巧克力之外，還可以聽到吃巧克力的聲音!

content.en: This museum is easy to find. It's at the end of Chocolate Street! Look for a big chocolate bar with white filling in the middle. That's the museum!
content.tw: 這個博物館很好找，就是在巧克力街的街尾，那棟很像夾心巧克力棒的建築!

content.en: Do you love chocolate? You'll love learning about, and eating, Taiwan's chocolate at this museum!
content.tw: 你喜歡巧克力嗎？你一定會喜歡在這座博物館裡學習和品嚐台灣的巧克力！

vocabulary.preface: 有關食物的博物館，真是個好主意!

content.text:
1. favorite 最喜歡的。
What are you cooking? 你在煮什麼?
Smells great! 太香了!
I'm baking bacon and potatoes. 我正在烤培根馬鈴薯。
Bacon! My favorite food! 培根是我的最愛!

2. taste 品嚐。
I know. You can enjoy it in 10 minutes.我知道，再十分鐘你就可以吃到了。
It's almost done. 就快好了。
Can I taste it now? 我可以現在嚐一嚐嗎?
No, not a good idea to open the oven now. 不行，現在打開烤箱不好。

3. hear 聽到。
Do you hear the sizzling sound? 你聽到滋滋聲了嗎?
That means we're almost there. 那表示就快好了。
Yoohoo!

4. eat 吃。
Okay, my bacon and potato dish with garlic and pepper!
好了，我的大蒜胡椒烤培根馬鈴薯!
Mmmm, I could eat this every day. 我可以每天都吃這個。

vocabulary.postscript:
What's your favorite food?
來一起讀單字。favorite最喜歡的 taste品嚐 hear聽到 eat吃

quiz.question: 1. Where is Asia's first chocolate museum?
2. What can people do with chocolate at the museum?
3. What does the museum look like?

content.en: What food is this? It can be sweet… It can be bitter… It can be sweet AND bitter! You can eat it... You can drink it... You can wear it too!
content.tw: 猜猜這是什麼食物... 它可以是甜的，是苦的，它也可以又甜又苦，除了吃跟喝以外，你還可以穿在身上!

content.en: This food tastes great with ice cream... or toast… or bacon! It's one of the world's favorite foods. People have enjoyed it for thousands of years. Can you guess what it is?
content.tw: 千百年來人們都喜歡它，不管跟冰淇淋、吐司，或甚至跟培根一起吃，都很美味!

content.en: It's... chocolate! There are many fun things to learn about chocolate!
content.tw: 沒錯! 就是好吃又好玩的巧克力!

content.en: Did you know there's a chocolate museum in Taoyuan? It's Asia's first chocolate museum! You can learn about chocolate. And you can learn about Taiwan's chocolate, from its cocoa trees to its chocolate bars and snacks!
content.tw: 亞洲第一間巧克力博物館就在桃園! 你可以在那裏學到從可可樹到製作巧克力點心的知識。

content.en: You can see the world's tallest chocolate bar! You can see, smell, touch, taste... and hear chocolate! Is that the sound of chocolate in your mouth?
content.tw: 也可以在那裏看到世界最高的巧克力棒，除了看到、聞到、摸到巧克力之外，還可以聽到吃巧克力的聲音!

content.en: This museum is easy to find. It's at the end of Chocolate Street! Look for a big chocolate bar with white filling in the middle. That's the museum!
content.tw: 這個博物館很好找，就是在巧克力街的街尾，那棟很像夾心巧克力棒的建築!

content.en: Do you love chocolate? You'll love learning about, and eating, Taiwan's chocolate at this museum!
content.tw: 你喜歡巧克力嗎？你一定會喜歡在這個博物館學習並品嚐台灣的巧克力！

vocabulary.preface: 有關食物的博物館，真是個好主意!

content.text: 1. favorite 最喜歡的。 What are you cooking? 你在煮什麼? Smells great! 太香了! I'm baking bacon and potatoes. 我正在烤培根馬鈴薯。 Bacon! My favorite food! 培根是我的最愛!
2. taste 品嚐。 I know. You can enjoy it in 10 minutes.我知道，再十分鐘你就可以吃到了。 It's almost done. 就快好了。 Can I taste it now? 我可以現在嚐一嚐嗎? No, not a good idea to open the oven now. 不行，現在打開烤箱不好。
3. hear 聽到。 Do you hear the sizzling sound? 你聽到滋滋聲了嗎? That means we're almost there. 那表示就快好了。 Yoohoo!
4. eat 吃。 Okay, my bacon and potato dish with garlic and pepper! 好了，我的大蒜胡椒烤培根馬鈴薯! Mmmm, I could eat this every day. 我可以每天都吃這個。

vocabulary.postscript: What's your favorite food? 來一起讀單字。favorite最喜歡的 taste品嚐 hear聽到 eat吃

2. What can people do with chocolate at the museum?
3. What does the museum look like?

content.en: Robots can do many things. But they need to move to do those things. Scientists are looking for new ways to make robots move. With no batteries or wires, robots could do many more things.
content.tw: 機器人可以做很多事，科學家正在找出不用電池或電線就能移動的方法，這樣機器人就可以做更多事!

content.en: Can a mushroom move a robot? What??? That sounds funny! But mushrooms have mycelia.
content.tw: 也許蘑菇可以移動機器人哦! 雖然聽起來好笑，但蘑菇裡有 mycelia ，也就是菌絲體。

content.en: Mycelia are thin white lines in mushroom roots. Mycelia can send electric signals!
content.tw: 菌絲體是磨菇根部細細的白色絲狀物，它們可以傳送電訊！

content.en: Scientists made two robots. One robot has legs. The other robot has wheels. They grew mycelia in the robots. Then they used the mycelia's electric signals. The robots moved!
content.tw: 科學家做了兩種機器人，一種有雙腳，一種裝有輪子。他們在機器人裡面培養菌絲體，並利用牠們傳遞訊號，讓機器人動起來！

content.en: Mycelia are very strong. They can live in very cold places. They can live in salt water. They can live in some places that are too dangerous for people! Maybe mycelia can help robots do more.
content.tw: 菌絲體很強，可以在低溫、鹽水或是其他人類無法生存的地方生長，也許牠們能夠幫助機器人做更多事情。

content.en: Moving robots with mycelia is great! Living things and machines can work together!
content.tw: 用菌絲體移動機器人真是太棒了！生物和機器可以一起工作！

vocabulary.preface: 機器人不用電池電線，就可以自行移動，這是一大進步。

content.text:
1. have 有。
I still can't imagine having a robot in my house.
我還是不能想像有個機器人在家裡。
That's because you don't have one. 那是因為你沒有。
No, even if I could buy one, I don't want it. 不是，就算我能買，我也不要。

2. leg 腿。
I especially don't want a robot with legs and
hands.我尤其不要有腿有手的機器人。
It's too scary!太恐怖了!
What if it can cook for you? 要是它能替你做飯呢?
No.不要。

3. machine 機器。
Why not? 為什麼不要?
Because it's a machine! 因為它是機器。
Come on, you have machines all around you.好了，你周圍都是機器。

4. make 命令。
Yeah, but they don't move. 對，但是它們不會動。
A robot doesn't move unless you make it.機器人也不會動，除非你叫它動。

vocabulary.postscript:
Would you like a robot at home? 來讀單字。
have有 leg腿 machine機器 make命令

quiz.question: 1. What can mycelia do?
2. What does one robot made by the scientists have?
3. What is good about using mycelia in robots?

content.en: On a small island in Iceland, families join the "Puffin Patrol." They have boxes and flashlights. They search the streets at night. They look for lost pufflings!
content.tw: 在冰島，有一些家庭會加入海鸚鵡巡邏隊。他們會在晚上帶著箱子跟手電筒，到街上尋找走失的小海鸚鵡！

content.en: Pufflings are baby puffins. These birds live by the ocean. They are black and white. They look like they're wearing tuxedos! In the summer, their beaks have bright colors.
content.tw: Puffling 就是小海鸚鵡。牠們住在海邊，有著像燕尾服的黑白色皮毛，到了夏天，牠們的嘴巴會變成明亮的顏色。

content.en: Six-week-old pufflings leave their homes. They fly to the ocean. The moon's light shows them the way.
content.tw: 六個月大的小海鸚鵡會離開家裡，飛向海邊。月光會引導牠們方向。

content.en: But some pufflings see city lights. They think the lights are the moon. The lights are not near the ocean. In the city, cars, cats, and dogs can hurt them!
content.tw: 但是有一些小海鸚鵡以為城市的光線是月光，所以飛到有車子、貓跟狗的城市，這很危險！

content.en: These pufflings are lost! And that's when the Puffin Patrol helps! Families carefully pick up the pufflings. They keep the birds safe in the boxes.
content.tw: 好險巡邏隊前來救援！他們會把找到的小海鸚鵡放在安全的箱子裡。

content.en: The next morning, the families take the pufflings to the ocean. There, they let the pufflings go free!
content.tw: 隔天早上，他們帶著小鸚鵡到海邊，讓牠們自由！

content.en: Saving pufflings is very important. Puffins are endangered in Iceland. Climate change and dirty oceans are bad for them.
content.tw: 搶救小海鸚鵡很重要，海鸚鵡因為氣候暖化跟海洋污染，已經快要絕種了。

content.en: But thanks to the Puffin Patrol, many lost pufflings are saved!
content.tw: 但多虧了海鸚鵡巡邏隊，許多走失的小海鸚鵡得以獲救！

vocabulary.preface: 冰島人正在努力搶救海鸚鵡，一種可愛的海鳥。

content.text:
1) look for 尋找.
What are you looking for? 你在找什麼?
A kingfisher.翠鳥.
I heard it but couldn't see it.我有聽到，但是看不到.

2) bright 明亮的.
What does it look like?牠長什麼樣子?
It has a bright orange belly, 牠有亮橘色的肚子，and a blue head.
藍色的頭。That should be easy to see.那應該很容易看到.

3) go 去.
No, it flies too fast. 不容易，牠飛太快。
It goes to the water, catches fish and flies right back.牠去到水裡，抓魚，然後立刻飛回來。

4) small 小的.
There it is! 在那裏!
The one on the tree branch! 在那根樹枝上。
You're right !你說對了!
Look how small it is, but so beautiful under the sun.你看牠好小，但是在陽光下真漂亮。

vocabulary.postscript:
Have you ever seen a kingfisher?
look for尋找 bright明亮的 go去 small小的

2. What do some pufflings think are the moon?
3. What is bad for puffins?

title: The Pasta'ay Festival Is About Something Serious

content.en: The Saisiyat are one of the Indigenous Taiwanese Peoples. Long ago, there were many Saisiyat people. Today, there are around six thousand Saisiyat in Taiwan.
content.tw: 賽夏族是台灣的原住民族，原本人口很多的他們，現在只有大約 6 千人。

content.en: But the Saisiyat have saved their traditions. One tradition is a very interesting festival!
content.tw: 但是賽夏族保留了他們的傳統節慶，其中一個很有趣哦！

content.en: People usually have happy festivals. But the Saisiyat have a very different one. It's not a sad festival. But it's also not a happy one. They have their Pasta'ay Festival to say "sorry."
content.tw: 大部分的慶典都是歡樂的，但賽夏族有一個很不一樣的節慶，既不悲傷也不歡樂，為什麼呢？因為他們的矮靈祭，是為了道歉。

content.en: The Saisiyat have a story. A long time ago, there were some very short people. They were about one meter tall. They taught the Saisiyat how to grow food. But then the short people and the Saisiyat had a big fight. The short people went away.
content.tw: 很久以前，矮人族教導賽夏族怎麼種植食物，但是之後他們有了紛爭，矮人族就生氣離開了！

content.en: Now the Saisiyat have this festival every two years. They dance and sing for a long time. In the dances and songs, they say "sorry" to the short people.
content.tw: 現在賽夏族人每兩年舉辦一次矮靈祭，他們會唱歌跳舞，用音樂跟舞蹈，表達對矮人族的歉意。

content.en: The Pasta'ay Festival is this weekend in Miaoli and Hsinchu!
content.tw: 矮靈祭本週末將在苗栗和新竹舉行！

content.text:
1. festival 慶典。
Have you ever been to any Indigenous people's festivals?
你有去過原住民的慶典嗎?
No. Have you? 沒有。你呢?
No, but I'd like to see one.沒有，不過我很想看看。

2. sing 唱歌，dance 跳舞。
I guess there would be lots of singing and dancing. 我猜有很多唱歌跳舞。Yeah,
and maybe some good food too. 對，也許還有好吃的食物。

3. people 人群。
But do you know what's the world's biggest festival?
但是你可知道世界最大的節慶是哪個?
Let me guess. Rio's Carnival? 我來猜。里約的嘉年華嗎?
You got it. 猜對了。
Two million people join it every year.每年有兩百萬人參加。

4. interesting 有趣的。
It must be a very interesting event. 一定是非常好玩的活動。
Must be. 肯定的。
Too bad Brazil is so far away. 可惜巴西那麼遠。

vocabulary.postscript:
Have you been to any big festivals?
festival慶典 sing唱歌 dance跳舞 people 人群 interesting 有趣的

2. What do people say at this festival?

title: Where Millions of Tons of Plastic Waste Go

content.en: Plastic makes our lives easier. We use a lot... and we throw away a lot.
content.tw: 我們使用很多塑膠產品，也扔掉很多。

content.en: Some goes into water or on land. Scientists looked at this kind of plastic waste. They say there's 57 million tons of it every year. They found where it goes.
content.tw: 每年有5700萬噸，會跑到水裡或是留在地面！

content.en: This plastic goes everywhere on Earth. Then it becomes microplastics. They are very small. Most are too small to see. They are in the air, our food, our water, and our bodies!
content.tw: 它們到處都是，會變成小到幾乎看不見的塑膠微粒，跑進空氣、食物、水，甚至我們的身體裡！

content.en: Taiwan is good about recycling plastic. But we use lots of plastic too. Taiwan says everybody here uses 700 plastic bags every year!
content.tw: 雖然台灣塑膠回收做得很好，但我們每一個人一年會用 700 個塑膠袋。

content.en: Plastic and microplastics hurt us and the Earth. We know this. But we keep using plastic and throwing it away. So more plastic is made. Now more than 400 million tons is made. Twenty-five years from now, more than one billion tons will be made!
content.tw: 因為我們用完就丟，所以塑膠生產量一直增加。現在世界每年製造超過 4 億噸塑膠，25 年後，會超過十億噸！

content.en: We can help the Earth. Let's use less plastic and recycle more. That's good for us too!
content.tw: 我們可以幫助地球。讓我們少用塑膠，多加回收。這對我們也有好處！

vocabulary.preface: 雖然大家回收很多塑膠製品，流落在外面的還是太多。

content.text:
1) water 水。
Yuck, so many cups in the water! 好噁，水裡那麼多杯子!
People are so careless. 大家太粗心了。
Yeah, they drank up their drinks, 對啊，他們把冷飲喝完，
and just threw the cups into the river. 就把杯子扔進河裡。

2) recycle 回收。
Somebody should invent cups that fish can eat.應該有人發明魚會吃的杯子。
Everybody should bring the cups home and recycle them.
應該每個人把杯子帶回家回收。

3) everywhere 到處。
Who would do something like that? 誰會那麼做?
I would. 我會。
Not me. I would toss the cups right away. 我可不。我會把馬上把杯子扔掉。
No wonder there's garbage everywhere.難怪到處都是垃圾。
Hey, that's unfair. 這麼講不公平。

vocabulary.postscript:
Do you recycle plastics? 請跟我一起複習單字
water水 recycle回收 everywhere到處

2. What does plastic in water and on land become?
3. How many plastic bags a year does each person use in Taiwan?

title: Many People Want to Be Flight Attendants

content.en: What do you want to be when you grow up? Maybe you want to be a firefighter or a police officer. You can help people. Maybe you want to be a race car driver. You can drive fast!
content.tw: 你長大之後想做什麼呢? 也許你想當消防員或警察幫助別人，或是當賽車手開快車!

content.en: How about a flight attendant? You can fly around the world! Many people want to be flight attendants.
content.tw: 也有很多人想當空服員，飛來飛去環遊世界。你想當空服員嗎?

content.en: An airline in Taiwan needs new flight attendants. More than 1,300 people want the jobs! How many new flight attendant jobs does the airline have? They have 12! Wow! Most of those people won't become flight attendants with this airline.
content.tw: 台灣有一間航空公司在徵求空服員，超過 1300 個人申請! 但是他們絕大部分會失望，因為公司只需要 12 個人。

content.en: Why does the airline need 12 new flight attendants? It bought some new planes. And more people are flying now. They don't worry about COVID-19 now.
content.tw: 為什麼需要新的空服員呢? 疫情之後有更多人想要旅行，所以航空公司買了新飛機。

content.en: The flight attendants will fly from Taipei or Kaohsiung. They will fly in Taiwan and to other countries. It's a good job.
content.tw: 這些空服員會從台北或高雄出發，飛往國內或是國際的大都市，是一份好工作。

content.en: It's not easy to get a good job. Companies want the best workers. So study hard at school! Then you can get a good job when you grow up!
content.tw: 找到一份好工作並不容易。公司想要最好的員工。所以努力學習吧！這樣你長大後就能找到一份好工作！

vocabulary.preface: 很多人想當空服員，但是很少人能成功。

content.text: 1. job 工作。Did you see this airline's ad? 你看到這家航空公司的廣告了嗎?Yeah, I did, and I've already signed up. 看到了，我也已經報名了。You really want the job, don't you? 你真的很想要這個工作，是吧?I do.是啊。
2. get 得到。And I hope this time I can get it. 我希望這次能得到。I hope so, too.我也希望。I can help you with interviews, you know. 我可以幫你練習面試。That'll be great, I need that. 太好了，我需要。
3. how many 多少。How many people want this job, do you know? 你知不知道有多少人想要這份工作?More than four thousand, I think.我想有四千多人吧。
4. easy 容易的。Wow, that's really a lot ! 真的很多人。Yeah, it won't be easy. 是不容易。

vocabulary.postscript: 今天學到的單字每天都用得到。job工作 get得到 how many多少 easy容易的

quiz.question: 1. In which job can you help people?
2. How many new flight attendants does the airline need?
3. Why does the airline need new flight attendants?

title: A Big Social Media Change for Teens

content.en: Many teenagers are on social media. Some of their accounts are changing …
content.tw: 有很多青少年用社群媒體，有一些帳號將會有很大的改變。

content.en: In Australia, Canada, the UK, and the USA, new teen accounts are keeping teens safe online. They are for 13 to 17-year-old teens. Next year, teens here will get them too.
content.tw: 青少年帳號會保護 13 到 17 歲的青少年，目前在澳洲、加拿大、英國跟美國進行，明年台灣也會有!

content.en: Experts say social media is bad for teens. It has lots of bullies and strangers. And some teens cannot stop looking at social media!
content.tw: 專家說社群媒體對青少年來說是不好的，它有很多陌生人跟霸凌者。有一些青少年可能會用到上癮!

content.en: Teen accounts are private. Teens talk with people they want to talk with. Bullies and strangers cannot talk with teens. They cannot see pictures or write in teen accounts.
content.tw: 青少年帳號會是私人的，能用來跟朋友聊天，但陌生人或霸凌者沒辦法跟他們講話，或是看他們的照片。

content.en: With teen accounts, teens cannot see everything on social media. Parents say how long their teen can use it. This means teens cannot look at social media for too long... or too late at night! Parents can see who their teens talked with. They can see what their teens looked at!
content.tw: 青少年帳號會限制他們能看到的東西，父母也可以限制他們的時間，不能太長，也不能太晚，還可以知道他們的孩子在跟誰聊天，或是看了哪一些網頁！

content.en: This social media makeover for teens keeps them safe online!
content.tw: 這次社群媒體為青少年做的改造，讓他們在線上更安全！

vocabulary.preface: 青少年有自己的帳號，比較安全。

content.text:
1. social media 社群媒體。
Who are you looking at? 你在看誰?
Only Cristiano Ronaldo. 只是在看C羅。
And I'm not the only one.不只是有我。
He has 985 million social media followers! 他有九億八千五百萬社群媒體粉絲!

2. talk 交談。
That's amazing! 真驚人!
I know. I hope I can talk to him someday. 我知道。真希望有一天能跟他講話。

3. online 上網。
You can try to do that online.你可以試試跟他上網交談。
Online talking is different.上網談不一樣。

4. picture 圖片或是照片。
It's better than nothing. 總比沒有好。
For now his pictures are good enough for me. 以現在來說他的照片就夠了。

vocabulary.postscript:
Do you often go online? 請跟我一起讀單字。
social media社群媒體 talk交談 online上網 picture圖片或是照片

content.en: Something very exciting happened in Taichung. A fast race car raced on Shizheng Road! Sixty thousand people came to watch! It was a fun, noisy day!
content.tw: 台中有一件刺激的事情！一輛超快的賽車在市政路上飆車，吸引六萬人來觀看，是熱鬧的一天！

content.en: This was Taiwan's first F1 showrun! In a showrun, race cars drive on city streets. People are close to the race cars!
content.tw: 這是台灣第一次F1賽車表演，人們可以在熟悉的街道旁，近距離觀看賽車飆車 !

content.en: But what is an F1 car? "F1" means "Formula One." That's a very fast racing sport. F1 cars are very fast. They have one seat. The cars are open, so F1 drivers wear a helmet. The big, wide tires are outside of the car. These cars race on racetracks all around the world.
content.tw: F1 的意思是 Formula 1，也就是一級方程式賽車，會在世界各地比賽。這些車子只有一個座位，而且是敞篷的，所以賽車手得戴上頭盔。車子外面有大大的輪子。

content.en: For the showrun, Taichung made sure the road was smooth. An F1 driver zoomed along the road! His race car roared! He made the car spin!
content.tw: 台中特別把道路弄得平滑，讓F1車手可以在路上呼嘯而過，還讓車子原地旋轉！

content.en: He drove three times. Each time he did more. He made the car slide! His tires drew circles on the road! He turned very fast, and smoke and fire came from a tire! Whoaaaa!
content.tw: 他的三次表演包含了很多特技！他讓車子滑行、讓輪胎在路上畫出圓圈，還冒出煙跟火！哇!

content.en: The showrun was very exciting! For people who love F1 cars and racing, it was a great day!
content.tw: 這場表演非常刺激！對於喜歡F1賽車和賽車運動的人來說，這是美好的一天！

vocabulary.preface: 台中市九月舉行的賽車展演，讓市民大開眼界!

content.text:
1. race 比賽。
There's a strange car on the street.街上有一部奇怪的車。
Hey, that's a race car, how interesting! 那是一輛賽車，真有趣!
It has only one seat and no roof. 它只有一個座位，沒有車頂。

2. drive 駕駛。
Yeah, one can drive very fast in a car like that. 那種車可以開非常快。
You already drive too fast, Paz.你已經開太快了!

3. make sure 確保。
I always make sure I'm not a danger to others.我都確保不會對別人造成危險。
Or to yourself.或者是對你自己。
Or to myself.或是我自己。

4. turn 轉彎。
So do you need a ride? 你想搭便車嗎?
Of course! 當然! But please, don't turn so suddenly. 但是拜託不要突然轉彎。

vocabulary.postscript: 今天的單字你記住了嗎?race比賽 drive駕駛 make sure確保 turn轉彎

title: As Glaciers Melt, Submarine Looks at Mud Piles

content.en: In Greenland, big, slow ice rivers are melting. These are glaciers. Climate change is melting them.
content.tw: 在冰島，因為氣候快速變遷，巨大的冰川正在融化。

content.en: Water from melting glaciers makes oceans rise. Rising oceans can flood cities near them! One billion people live in these cities!
content.tw: 融化的冰川讓海平面升高，可能會淹沒海邊的城市！有十億個人住在這些城市裡。

content.en: Scientists are studying piles in front of glaciers. They are made of mud and rocks. Maybe they keep warm ocean water away from glaciers. Maybe they make glaciers melt more slowly!
content.tw: 科學家正在研究冰川前的堆積物，它們是由泥土和岩石組成。也許能把溫暖的海水擋在冰川外面，讓冰川融化得慢一點!

content.en: But it’s too dangerous for people to go to the piles! Big pieces of ice can fall! So scientists sent a robot submarine. They moved it with a video game controller!
content.tw: 但是，親自調查那些堆積物很危險，隨時會有冰塊掉落！所以科學家們派了一艘機器潛水艇，並用遙控器控制！

content.en: The scientists got information about the piles! Maybe it will help them make glaciers melt more slowly. Maybe one day walls will be put in front of glaciers! Then the oceans will rise more slowly. Cities will have more time to become safe from floods!
content.tw: 科學家現在更加了解那些堆積物，也許有一天，冰川前面會有一道高牆來保護它們! 這樣海洋就會上升得更慢。城市將有更多時間免受洪水侵擾！

vocabulary.preface: 科學家想要更了解冰河，希望減緩它的融解速度。

content.text:
1. ice 冰。
Have you ever seen glaciers?你有看過冰河嗎?
Yeah, in Iceland. 有，在冰島。
What are they like? 它們是什麼樣子?
More like a big, long piece of dirty ice. 比較像一塊很大很長的，髒髒的冰塊。

2. slowly 慢的。
So it doesn’t look like a river? 所以看起來不像河流?
No, not at all.一點也不像。
It moves so slowly you’d think it just stays there.它移動得很慢，慢到你以為它就待在那裏。

3. made of 做成。
Did you touch it? 你有碰到它嗎?
Yeah, it’s cold. 有，是冷的。
After all, it’s made of ice. 它畢竟是由冰塊組成的。

4. melt 融化。
Does a glacier melt in summer time? 夏天的時候冰河會不會融化?
I believe it does, but not much.我想會，但是融的不多。

vocabulary.postscript:
你想要拜訪冰河嗎?
ice冰 slowly慢的 made of做成 melt融化

quiz.question: 1. What happens when glaciers melt?
2. What did scientists use to study the piles?
3. What do the piles do for the glacier?
options: b. Bring warm water to it

content.en: Lobsters live at the bottom of the ocean. They have long bodies and ten legs. Their big front legs have big claws! Watch out!
content.tw: 龍蝦住在海底，牠們有長長的身體跟十隻腳，小心哦! 牠們的兩隻前腳有巨大的鉗子!

content.en: Most lobsters are dark red or brown. But lobsters can be other colors too.
content.tw: 大部分龍蝦是深紅色或是咖啡色，但是還有其他種顏色。

content.en: There are orange lobsters, blue lobsters, white lobsters, and light blue lobsters. Some lobsters have one color on their left side and one color on their right side!
content.tw: 有橘色、藍色、白色還有淺藍色的龍蝦。有一些龍蝦身體的左邊跟右邊顏色不一樣!

content.en: Fishermen say finding colored lobsters was difficult. But now they are finding more! They find colored lobsters in some parts of the U.S.
content.tw: 漁夫說以前要找到彩色龍蝦很難，但是現在在美國某一些地方，它們有發現比較多。

content.en: The food that lobsters eat can decide their color. The DNA of lobsters also decides their color. Scientists want to test the colored lobsters' DNA. They want to know why lobsters are different colors. Now they are making tests. These tests don't hurt lobsters.
content.tw: 龍蝦的顏色會受到基因跟食物的影響。科學家正在做實驗，希望更清楚了解為甚麼龍蝦有不同的顏色。

content.en: Lots of people like to eat cooked lobster. Cooked lobsters - orange, blue, two-colored, or brown - all become red. People say all these lobsters taste the same. But some people don't want to eat colored lobsters! No thank you! Do you like to eat lobster? Will you eat a colored one?
content.tw: 很多人喜歡吃煮熟的龍蝦。煮熟的龍蝦——無論是橘色、藍色、雙色還是棕色——都會變成紅色。人們說這些龍蝦味道都一樣。但有些人不想吃彩色龍蝦！不用了，謝謝！你喜歡吃龍蝦嗎？你會吃有顏色的龍蝦嗎？

vocabulary.preface: 科學家正在研究龍蝦的顏色，是否跟牠的食物有關。

content.text:
1. lobster 龍蝦。
We're having lobster pasta tonight. 我們今晚吃龍蝦麵。
Wow, so fancy ! 真豪華!
What are we celebrating? 是要慶祝什麼?

2. find 發現。
My mother's birthday.我老媽的生日。
Your mom is coming here? 你媽媽要來這裡?
No, but I often find myself thinking about her.不過我發現我常想到她。

3. different 不同的。
She likes trying something different when she's bored.
她無聊時喜歡嘗試不一樣的東西。
That's interesting! 真有趣!

4. orange 橘色。
What else did she try?她還試過什麼?
A very orange cake made from oranges. 用橘子做的橘色蛋糕。
Oh…I prefer lobster pasta.我比較喜歡龍蝦麵。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的主題是什麼，還記得嗎?
lobster龍蝦 find發現 different不同的 orange橘色

2. What do scientists want to study?
3. What do scientists want to do to colored lobsters?

title: Scientists Think Mars Has Lots of Water

content.en: Water is important for life. On Earth, there is no life with no water. That is the same for other planets too, like Mars.
content.tw: 水非常重要，沒有水就沒有生命，在火星上也是。

content.en: Scientists think Mars had lots of water billions of years ago. Then all the water on Mars went away. Where did it go? Maybe some water went into space. But where did most of it go? No one knows.
content.tw: 科學者認為火星在幾十億年前有水，但之後水慢慢消失了，是跑到太空了嗎?沒有人知道。

content.en: But now scientists think there is lots of water there. What? Mars is very dry! It has cracks! Where is the water?
content.tw: 但科學家說，那裡現在還是有很多水，火星這麼乾，還有很多裂縫，怎麼可能有水?

content.en: Scientists think the water went down into the cracks. They think the water is deep in Mars now. They think it is 10 or 20 kilometers deep!
content.tw: 科學家認為水應該在裂縫深處，在火星地底 10 到 20 公里深!

content.en: Scientists think there is lots of water. It can make an ocean. It can cover all of Mars. It can be one or two kilometers deep. But it's deep in Mars.
content.tw: 科學家認為那些水足夠變成 1到2 公里深的海洋，覆蓋整個火星，只是現在在地底下。

content.en: Is there life on Mars? No one knows. Maybe we will find life there one day. But it will be very hard. The water is a long, long way down! What will life on Mars be like? Hmmmmm …
content.tw: 火星上有生命嗎？沒有人知道。或許有一天我們會在那裡找到生命。但這會非常困難。水在很深很深的地方！火星上的生命會是什麼樣子？嗯嗯嗯...

vocabulary.preface: 火星上的水，可能躲藏在很深的地底下。

content.text: 1. scientist 科學家。 Why are scientists so interested in Mars?為什麼科學家對火星那麼有興趣? I guess they want to move there. 我猜他們想搬去那裏。 To live on Mars? 去住在火星嗎? Yeah.是啊。
2. think 認為。 That's not a good idea, is it? 那不是個好主意吧? Probably not. 也許不是。 Do you think they can make it? 你覺得他們會成功嗎? Maybe. There's water on Mars. 也許可以，火星上有水。
3. space 太空。 But almost no oxygen. 但是幾乎沒有氧氣。 They can wear space suits. 他們可以穿太空衣。
4. can 可以或是能夠。 They can also stay indoors watching TV. 他們也可以待在室內看電視。 At least that's what they do in the movies.至少電影上是那樣。

vocabulary.postscript: 我們一起來讀單字。 scientist科學家 think認為 space太空 can可以或是能夠

quiz.question: 1. What do scientists think Mars had billions of years ago?
2. Where do scientists think the water on Mars went into?
3. Why will it be hard to find life on Mars?
options: a. It will be a long way down.
